titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Jones Gregory and James Bowren, Indictment
CWG5170

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
County of Graves } SS.

Graves Equity & Criminal Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against
Jones Gregory & James Bowren
The Grand Jury of Graves County in the name & by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Jones Gregory & James Bowren of the crime of Shooting at another with the intent to kill.

Committed as follows Viz: Said Jones Gregory & James on the 5th day of August 1861 in the County aforesaid did wilfully & Maliciously shoot and Wound W. C. Womack & T. J. Scofield with guns loaded with Powder & leaden Shot or bulletts or other hard substances, so that the said Womac & Scofield did did not die thereby against the peace & dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky
Thos H. Corbett Comlths Attorney first Judicial district
Information by Thos Barly. Wm Shorfield T J. Scofield. & Halcomb Jackson

Bail is fixed on this indictment at Five Hundred Dollars for Each defendant
J. M Bigger, Judge

A Copy attest
W A Turner C G C C
The Comlth of Ky.
vs. } Shooting with intent to kill
Jones Gregory
James Bowren

a true bill
S. W. Gray
Foreman

Filed Aug. 8th 1861
process issued Oct 1st 1861
Evan Anderson C G C C
By S. F Anderson D C
